Course Description: The aim of this basic core course is to provide students a good background in genetics, molecular biology. The major focus is to acquaint students with quantitative aspect of different kind of genetic inheritance and horizontal transfers. The course is also to provide introduction about different aspect of molecular aspect of gene regulation.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students can solve statistical problem of mendelian inheritance
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students can summarise non-mendelian inheritance and horizontal gene transfer
Course Outcomes.CO3: student can summarise different aspects of regulation through epigenome and proteome
Course Outcomes.CO4: student can solve quantitative problem of population genetics

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: An Introduction to DNA structure and variations, quantitive Genetics, statistical aspect of mendelian inheritance and non-mendelian genetics, gene interaction based moifications (epistasis). Bacterial and Viral gene transfers evolution, tranferable elements in eukaryotic genome
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Lab (tentative) : DNA extraction, purification, amplication Assignment -1: statistical problem related to mendelian and non-mendelian inheritance

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Detail of Gene regulation /contol of gene expression in prokaryotes and eukaryotes, introduction to epigenomics, proteomics
Detail of Molecular biology aspect of epigenome and proteome invloved in regulation, transcription factors
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Lab (tentative) : RNA extraction, reverse transcription Assignment-2: Reading of publications related to regulation and summarising in own words
Assignment-3: solving numerical problem related to population genetics

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Introduction to sources of data in genomics, proteomics and population genetics for quantitaive analysis
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Assignment-3: solving numerical problem related to population genetics

Textbook: B. Pierce, Genetics: A conceptual approach,
Watson et al., Molecular biology of Gene
